summary: An email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen of Wigdor LLP forwarding photos allegedly showing Jeffrey Epstein on a boat in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard, in summer 2003, with a young blonde woman. The email states the photos were taken by Ghislaine Maxwell and that the client stayed overnight.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Partner at Wigdor LLP who sent the email forwarding photos of Jeffrey Epstein on a boat, referencing her client's information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Allegedly shown in photos on a boat in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard, with a young blonde woman in summer 2003.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: According to the attorney's client, Maxwell took the photos of Epstein on the boat.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have taken photos of Epstein on a boat with a young woman in summer 2003.
Christensen, an attorney, is forwarding photos and information related to Epstein as part of legal correspondence.

events.title: Epstein on boat in Martha's Vineyard
events.description: Photos allegedly show Jeffrey Epstein on a boat in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard, with a young blonde woman. The attorney's client states they stayed overnight one night and that Ghislaine Maxwell took the photos.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor LLP office)
keyFacts: Photos allegedly show Jeffrey Epstein on a boat in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard, in summer 2003 with a young blonde woman.
The attorney's client claims Ghislaine Maxwell took the photos.
The client stated they stayed overnight for one night during this incident.
The email is from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen of Wigdor LLP, indicating legal handling of this evidence.
The location is identified as Oak Bluffs harbor, with houses in the background said to still be confirmable today.
